These plants are characterized by their broad, flat leaves that often float on the water surface or are submerged. Macrostelia species are found in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds and rivers. Their botanical features make them important components of aquatic ecosystems, providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms.
